page.title: 09Employment
page.content: I Button Making. A Mr. & Mrs. Case started making buttons in the early eighteenth century in Milborne. The first buttons were made with wire and cotton, the wire was for the frame. In I850 the Aston family brought a button making machine to Milborne, this meant that the woman and children lost their jobs. The Case family died in I912 and the craft tended to die out. Slowly the women and children started to bring the craft back and at present a number of women still make the Dorset button in Milborne. Traditional designs are based on the Union Jack and are often square or rectangular while others are round, with a series of dots of several colours.{
